physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Recurrent breakdown of the surgical scalp wound requiring debridement. Underlying bone appeared normal at the time of surgery. Debrided material revealed moderate polymorphonuclear leukocytes and a few gram-positive cocci, with MRSA cultured.
Purulent drainage from the scalp wound with MRSA cultured, identical susceptibility profile to previous isolate.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Clindamycin prescribed but drainage and breakdown progressed.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Readmitted for surgical debridement. Softening of the underlying bone noted, consistent with osteomyelitis.
Received a 6-week course of vancomycin and rifampin therapy. No recurrence of infection or inflammation observed over the following year.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Improvement noted with resolution of inflammation and no recurrences.
